title: Official JSON schema for the Timber librarie's log events (https://github.com/timberio/log-event-json-schema)

dt.description: The IOS8601 formatted datetime when the log was generated.

level.description: The descriptive level of the log in string format. The available options adhere to the Syslog 5424 specification.

severity.description: The numerical severity of the message represented by an integer between 0 and 7. The available options adhere to the Syslog 5424 specification.

message.description: The raw log event message, formatting stripped.

tags.description: An array of tags to be associated with this log line.

context.description: Contextual metadata about the environment the event takes place in

custom.description: An open ended object where custom context is supplied.

http.description: Context about the HTTP request currently being processed (if any)

job.description: Represents a task or job execution, typically for background tasks or jobs.

id.description: A unique identifier for the job or task.

organization.description: Represents an organization in the platform being logged. The interpretation of "organization" is left to the consumer.

id.description: A unique identifier for the organization

name.description: A display name for the organization

platform.description: Contextual information about the hosting platform (AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, etc) the application is hosted.

heroku.description: Contextual information for the Heroku platform.

dyno_type.description: The dyno type for the process (web, worker, router, etc)

dyno_id.description: The dyno ID for the process.

source.description: The source of the log message. For example, Heroku can send log messages for the web.1 dyno from both within the app and Heroku itself.

release.description: Contextual information on the current release

commit_hash.description: The git commit sha for the deploy

created_at.description: When the release was created, ISO8601 date time.

version.description: Deploy version, can be an unique string. Ex: 1.1.2 or a43fdw

class_name.description: The current class name, if applicable.

file.description: The current file path from the root of the project.

function.description: The current function name, if applicable.

line.description: The current line number with in the file.

module_name.description: The current module name, if applicable.

vm_pid.description: The logical process ID as defined by the current language, if applicable.

session.description: The user's current session. A session is a way to track a user without the need for authentication. For example, a browser session is generally maintained through a cookie and assigned a unique ID.

id.description: The unique ID of this session.

system.description: Host and system level details tha the log was generated on.

ip.description: The system's IP address (v4 or v6).

pid.description: The system's process ID as defined by the `pid` command in Unix.

user.description: Represents a user in the platform being logged. The interpretation of "user" is left to the consumer.

id.description: A unique identifier for the user.

name.description: A display name for the user.

email.description: An email address for the user. This need not be unique to the user. Note that no validation is performed on this field.

event.description: A controlled representation of the event this log line represents.

controller_call.description: Represents the calling of a controller, typically logged immediately after the request is routed.

controller.description: The name of the controller being called.

action.description: The name of the controller action being called.

params_json.description: A JSON encoded representation of the parsed parameters being sent to the controller.

custom.description: An open ended object used for custom event data. Only a single root key is allowed, this represents the event type and avoids type collisions in the context of the entire schema.

backtrace.description: An optional array of lines, representing the call stack, leading up to the error.

app_name.description: Application name, if applicable. For example, erlang / elixir have multiple apps within the same umbrella project.

http_request.description: Represents a HTTP request, both incoming and outgoing. Note the direction field.

http_response.description: Represents a HTTP response event, both outgoing and incoming. Note the direction field.

resource_sample.description: Represents a resource usage sample for a target server, application, or both.

cpu.description: A sample of the current server processor usage.

load_avg_1m.description: The load average for the processor in the last 1 minute. This reflects the number of CPU tasks that are in the ready queue (i.e. waiting to be processed).

load_avg_5m.description: The load average for the processor in the last 5 minutes. This reflects the number of CPU tasks that are in the ready queue (i.e. waiting to be processed).

load_avg_15m.description: The load average for the processor in the last 10 minutes. This reflects the number of CPU tasks that are in the ready queue (i.e. waiting to be processed).

cache.description: A sample of cache statistics and state.

active_connections.description: The number of active connections established with the database.

index_cache_hit_rate.description: The ratio of successful reads out of all read operations.

database.description: A sample of database statistics and state.

db_size.description: The number of bytes contained in the database. This includes all table and index data on disk, including database bloat.

tables.description: The number of tables in the database

active_connections.description: The number of active connections established with the database.

current_transaction.description: The current transaction ID, which can be used to track writes over time.

index_cache_hit_rate.description: Ratio of queries that used an index (instead of only sequential scans), rounded to five decimal points.

table_cache_hit_rate.description: Ratio of table lookups served from shared buffer cache, rounded to five decimal points.

waiting_connections.description: Number of connections waiting on a lock to be acquired.

disk.description: A sample of a server's disk usage.

read_iops.description: Number of read operations in I/O sizes of 16KB blocks.

write_iops.description: Number of write operations in I/O sizes of 16KB blocks.

memory.description: A sample of a server's memory usage.

cache_mb.description: The portion of the memory used for disk cache.

free_mb.description: The amount of free memory availabe in megabytes.

pgpgin.description: The cumulative total of the pages read from disk. Sudden high variations on this number can indicate short duration spikes in swap usage. The other memory related metrics are point in time snapshots and can miss short spikes.

pgpgout.description: The cumulative total of the pages written to disk. Sudden high variations on this number can indicate short duration spikes in swap usage. The other memory related metrics are point in time snapshots and can miss short spikes.

rss_mb.description: The portion of the memory being used by the target application oin megabytes.

swap_mb.description: The portion of the memory stored on disk. Swap usually indicates a shortage of memory in megabytes.

total_mb.description: The sum of the rss, cache, and swap that equals the total memory being used in megabytes.

sql_query.description: An outgoing SQL query sent from the application.

template_render.description: Rendering a template to be sent to the client via the HTTP response.

name.description: The unique name of the template. This generally includes the path.

http_body.description: The body of the HTTP request / response.

http_content_length.description: The value of the Content-Length header representing the size of the request in decimal number of octets.

http_headers.description: An object representing *select* HTTP headers that need to be searched or graphed.

http_headers_json.description: A string representing *all* HTTP headers, this is solely used for request inspection.

http_host.description: The target host of the HTTP request. This may not be the same as the real hostname of the server.

http_method.description: The HTTP method for the request.

http_path.description: The path of the HTTP request.

http_port.description: The target port of the HTTP request. This may be different than the port the server is listening on.

http_query_string.description: The query parameters present on the URL.

http_remote_addr.description: The IP address of the computer that issued the request.

http_request_id.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the request and can be used to trace requests.

http_service_name.description: A short label / name for the service you are sending the request to, ex: elasticsearch

http_status.description: The status as defined by the HTTP status codes.

time_ms.description: The duration, in fractional milliseconds, that it took to complete this event.
